intro: Bartsia flava subsp. minor, commonly known as the lesser yellow monkeyflower, is a small herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in dense racemes, and it has opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. It is often found in association with other flowering plants in its ecosystem.
